com.redhat.rhn.frontend.events

Class AbstractDatabaseAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.frontend.events.AbstractDatabaseAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageAction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CloneErrataAction, NewCloneErrataAction, SsmChangeBaseChannelSubscriptionsAction, SsmChangeChannelSubscriptionsAction, SsmConfigFilesAction, SsmDeleteServersAction, SsmErrataAction, SsmPackagesAction, SsmPowerManagementAction, SsmSystemRebootAction, SsmVerifyPackagesAction, UpdateErrataCacheAction

    public abstract class AbstractDatabaseAction
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageAction
    Base action for any action that communicates with the database. This class will take care of committing the transaction and any cleanup that is necessary.

      Constructors

      AbstractDatabaseAction() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract void doExecute(EventMessage msg)
      Performs the business logic of the action.
      void execute(EventMessage msg)
      Perform the action on the EventMessage
      protected void handleTransactions(boolean commit)
      Commits the current thread transaction, as well as close the Hibernate session.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractDatabaseAction

        public AbstractDatabaseAction()

    • Method Detail

      • doExecute

        protected abstract void doExecute(EventMessage msg)
        Performs the business logic of the action. This method should be implemented instead of overriding execute(EventMessage).
        Parameters:
        msg - event being executed; will not be null

      • execute

        public void execute(EventMessage msg)
        Perform the action on the EventMessage
        Specified by:
        execute in interface MessageAction
        Parameters:
        msg - EventMessage to execute.

      • handleTransactions

        protected void handleTransactions(boolean commit)
        Commits the current thread transaction, as well as close the Hibernate session.

        Note that this call MUST take place for any database operations done in a message queue action for the transaction to be committed.
